page.title: 16Biography
page.content: Mr.Austin Walker Mr.Walker is Chairman of Walgrave School Governors.He is also a member of Daventry District Council and is on the Housing Committee.He is the Chairman of the Village Charities Committee and every year 300 pounds is distributed to the elderly. Mr.Walker was born in Walgrave and attended the village school until he was 13 years old.He then worked on a farm and eventually became an apprentice to his uncle in the "Boot and Shoe" trade.During the war in 1940 Mr.Walker was serving in the Royal Military Police and was injured in the blitz in Liverpool.He then joined the Ministry of Defence and bought in supplies for them.He worked for 35 years for them and was awarded a medal for his hard work.
